results.adx_keywords: Football;Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy;Content Type: Personal Profile;Seizures (Medical);Thomas, Demaryius;McKee, Ann;Denver Broncos;National Football League;Boston University
results.title: An N.F.L. Star’s C.T.E. Diagnosis Offers Only Partial Insight
results.abstract: Demaryius Thomas had C.T.E. when he died in December at 33, but the posthumous diagnosis alone does not explain what role football had in the charismatic N.F.L. star’s quick decline.

media.caption: When Thomas left the field after Super Bowl 50, he had a headache so bad that he missed most of the celebrations after.
media.copyright: AAron Ontiveroz/The Denver Post via Getty Images

results.byline: By Victoria Kim and Amanda Holpuch
results.title: What We Know About the Shooting in Highland Park
results.abstract: Prosecutors lodged first-degree murder charges on Tuesday against a suspect who was taken into custody Monday evening.

media.caption: Strollers and bicycles left behind by families fleeing the July 4 mass shooting in Highland Park, Ill., remained scattered along sidewalks within the police crime-scene cordon on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Mary Mathis for The New York Times

results.byline: By Dan Simmons, Shawn Hubler and Noam Scheiber
results.title: Here is what we know about the victims of the Highland Park shooting.
results.abstract: A seventh person died on Tuesday. More than 30 people were wounded.

media.caption: Several hundred people gathered at Christ Church Lake Forest for a prayer vigil on Tuesday. Faith leaders from several area churches came together after a mass shooting Monday at a Fourth of July parade in nearby Highland Park, Ill.
media.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Highland Park Parade Shooting (July 4, 2022);Mass Shootings;Highland Park (Ill)
results.title: Highland Park Victim Was a Grandfather Who Hadn’t Wanted to Attend the Parade
results.abstract: Nicolas Toledo was sitting in his wheelchair along the parade route, between his son and a nephew, when the bullets started flying.

media.caption: Nicolas Toledo, 76, migrated between Mexico and the United States throughout his life, his family said. He was among those fatally shot in Highland Park. Ill., on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Mass Shootings;Highland Park Parade Shooting (July 4, 2022);Parades;Independence Day (US) (July 4);Highland Park (Ill)
results.title: The attack in Highland Park was not the only shooting over a violent holiday weekend.
results.abstract: As of early Monday morning, at least 57 people had been shot in Chicago alone over the Fourth of July weekend, nine of them fatally.

media.caption: FBI personnel in downtown Highland Park, Ill., on Monday, after a gunman opened fire on a crowd watching a Fourth of July parade.
media.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times

results.title: A Poor Country Made Bitcoin a National Currency. The Bet Isn’t Paying Off.

results.title: A Clunky Mask May Be the Answer to Airborne Disease and N95 Waste
results.abstract: Experts say the U.S. government has unintentionally encouraged a dependency on imported masks by failing to promote elastomeric respirators, a reusable mask that is domestically produced.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health

media.caption: Three years into the pandemic, elastomeric respirators — industrial-grade face masks familiar to car painters and construction workers — remain a rarity at U.S. health care facilities.
media.copyright: Kirsten Luce for The New York Times

results.title: Lonely Last Days in the Suburban Office Park
results.abstract: Yes, downtown offices are struggling. But there is a different kind of emptiness in suburban settings that were already isolated and lightly populated by design.

media.caption: The former Toys “R” Us headquarters in Wayne, N.J. Many places that have been office parks need a new identity.

results.title: New Insights Into Trump’s State of Mind on Jan. 6 Chip Away at Doubts
results.abstract: Former President Donald J. Trump has weathered scandals by keeping his intentions under wraps, but recent testimony paints a stark portrait of a man willing to do almost anything to hang onto power.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump greeting supporters at a rally in June. He has benefited from uncertainty about what he was thinking on the day of the Capitol riot.
